Fields.DialogueText: Gojuu! *SLASH* Gojuuichi! *SLASH* Gojuuni! *SLASH* Gojuusan! *SLASH* Gojuuyon! *SLASH*
What are you doing up this early, I-7? The sun isn't out yet.
Kanchou! The sun does not need to be out! What needs to be drawn is my sword, my blade, and soul! I am a warriorrrrr!

Fields.MenuText: Woah, easy there, tiger.
I-7, slow down!
This wouldn't happen to be what I think it is, is it?

Fields.DialogueText: Easy!? Yasashiidano!? Sore wa chigau! You are wrong! To take things easy is to drop into a grave easy! I will not stand for it, not now, not ever!
Hanasunaide! I shall continue practicing until I've slain 100 effigies! That way I will have memorized one hundred cuts, the better to slice the enemy into pieces!
U-Uah? Nani wo hanashimasu ka? This is only for... intense training! Yes! This is for intense training to become a stronger warrior, and nothing more!
I-7, I-7... *DON* All right, enough's enough. Come on, tell me what's going on? You're positively frazzled.
Ha. I-7, you know I can see right through you?
W-Wha!? How dare you insinuate that I have an ulterior motive! How dare you! I d-do not!
Uah! K-Kanchou... You used your bokuto to catch Koukinjitsu! Grrr... Hai. Kuyashi...
Embarrassing? What's so embarrassing? ... Oh, I think I know now. They assigned another Belle to protect Kure for the time being.
Yes! I am feeling rage! How dare they do such a thing! Do not they know my devotion to Kure!? Why would they take that away from me!?
I-7, I-7... It's all right. Please, I'm certain they didn't mean anything by it. Just to make sure of that, I'll draft a letter to them to see what's going on.
Tegami wo kakimasuka? Honto...? Ah, Kanchou... Your kindness shines through once again. But... the hurt still festers in my breast. What should we do?
I say we get in some practice. I think your slashing has attracted Morganas.
Heh! Yuurei no inu ga... I shall cleave them in two like everything else! Kanchou, junbi wa dekimasu ka?
As I'll ever be.
@BATTLE
Yoisho... Yoisho... Yoisho... Hah, I did not think such foreign concepts of "pull-ups" could be useful, but I am pleasantly surprised.
See? I enjoy doing pull-ups in the morning. Great exercise.
Ha..? Perhaps this is finally an explanation for my insult at Kure?
Again, I don't think he meant to insult me or you. Anyway... let's see here. Korea... I wonder what--
Allow me to read this! Hm... What!? He expects us to go to Chōsen immediately!?

Fields.MenuText: I wonder what's going on?
This somehow has less urgency than Okinawa...
What, is there a problem with that?

Fields.DialogueText: Wakarimasen. Shirimasen...! This is an OUTRAGE! How dare they send someone of my stature, MY station to such a lowly place!
Of course it does! No one with a gourd full of knowledge would go to Chōsen without either needing something there or by order. It is below my station!
And you don't see the problem!? The problem is that Chōsen is below my station! You would send a page to do such menial, unremissible garbage!
I-7, this is a direct order from the Navy Minister. We cannot refuse this. It will be fine, I assure you.
Grrr! Daijobu jyanai! First they replace me at Kure, then they expect me to go to where those filthy Kankokujin lurk!? Unacceptable. Yurusanai...!
I-7. Cut it out.
U-Uwargh... Kanchou...! H-Hai.
I know Kure means a lot to you, but we have a duty to uphold - to the world, not just to the IJA. To send a Belle to such a situation means that there's something big going on.
But they could've sent that damned jinroku, I-66! The daughter of a prostitute could easily clear such a task!
Don't talk about I-66 that way! Besides, the task must be incredibly difficult, which is why they're sending us instead of her. Why else would they send us?
I... I suppose that's true. Very well, I shall follow you, Kanchou. We will investigate Chōsen together. Who knows? There's an adventure to be had.
That's the spirit. How about you take your anger out on that Morgana?
Oho! ... Mochiron.
@BATTLE
Hm? Oh, a letter just arrived. Orders from the Navy Minister, it seems.
How the morning dew glitters upon the effigy...
You were complaining about having to go to Korea a couple days ago. You've sure changed your tune.
If that is your attempt at humor, I do not find it laughable. It's rather tart. If you have time to gawk and make jokes, then it is natural that you have time to practice.

Fields.MenuText: I'll have you know I practiced earlier.
Weather's good today, huh?
Care to spar, then?

Fields.DialogueText: Pah! That is not an excuse. Your words hold no weight; practice until you tire out! This is an order from the Navy Minister!
Tengi ga yoi -- eh, chotto matte! Trying to change the subject, how dare! I will not tolerate slacking. I will let I-6, that jinroku, slack, but not you! This is an order from the Prime Minister.
You think yourself lucky? I could cut you with the scabbard alone. Would you insinuate that you could take me when you are naught but a novice? Arrogant! The Navy Minister expects better!
Indeed, the Prime Minister has called us out. Though, I wonder what's going on in Korea? He was light on details.
It would normally be of little consequence. That upstart backwater is beneath me.
Given the Japanese naval history with Korea, I can see why you'd be a bit apprehensive. Still, don't let that stop you from training. Unless you feel like Admiral Yi's spirit haunts the place?
How dare you bring up such a...! Care to try my mettle, Kanchou? You will find plenty at the end of my blade.
Hoho. Unlucky for you, I-7. I'm not going to be that easy to take care of.
And why is that? ... Hm? What is that?
Do you like it? I picked it up while we were refueling in Osaka. It's not the finest quality bokuto, but it's at least made of mahogany.
Wahahaha! Sa... It's time to test to see if that piece of plywood can stand up to mine. How about we get started, then?
I'm ready for you when you are.
Haaaaaaaaaaaaaa!
Haaaaaaaaa!
Kurae! *SWOOSH* *THWACK*
Huh... For some reason, my bokuto didn't feel anything... What's--
A-Ack! Kanchou! Turn around! It's a Morgana! Isshyoni ikkimashou!
@BATTLE
I shall dry it with my blade.
Are we there yet, Kanchou? I must confess this has been rather long and I do not care for it.
Please be patient, I-7. We have to tread carefully.
Oh, you and the rest of the lot. Scary or not, we will simply slash through the Morganas.
If it were that easy, the war would have ended already.
A true warrior is fearless, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Fearless, but they should also be careful.
But not stupid.
We've got a team to worry about. It's not just our heads out here.

Fields.DialogueText: Tch... Ii pointo desu ne. Still, I wish they would move faster. If they fear the Morganas so much, they should move quickly.
To be careful should only apply to the cut of one's blade. That way, it shall be easier to cleave your foes in twain. Such is the way of a warrior. Let fear spur you to greater deeds.
Chotto matte, Kanchou. It is a warrior's duty to see that a mission is completed, especially one from an imperial official. Divine orders brook no fear.
So you would rather us be reckless? What about the last time you were?
Keh! Only a solitary mishap. It will not happen again on my watch. My warriors shall be without fear.
Having no fear is important, but making sure your people don't die senselessly is also a boon. Think: Tokugawa had five men at one point, did he not?

Iie, Kanchou. Tokugawa may have had five men, but none of those men were with fear. Look at Tsuneimon, or perhaps he who threw open the castle gates and beat the drum. In the end, we are all warriors.
Tell me, did Tokugawa waste any of those men?
Mou... Kanchou! I hate it when you make these points! They were without fear!
They were also smart. Hattori Hanzo made it seem like he had more men than he actually did, and never lost a single one.
Then to accomplish that... I shall train harder!
Look no further, then. It looks like we have some company ahead of us. A warm welcome to Korea!
Hell awaits you demons.
@BATTLE
Captain, we are receiving a transmission. According to the communications, it is from General Morooka - our Army contact in the area.
Put it up, then!
Hai, doumo, doumo. Welcome, Kanchou. Welcome to Keijō, and thank you for your arrival.
Glad to be here. What exactly are you having problems with? The Navy Minister said we were needed.
Well, as it turns out... Morganas have become quite troublesome lately. Muzukashikatta, if you will. Both I and my trusty lieutenant Sungmin have been trying to deal with them.
Morooka-san, would it not be wise to call for more aid? Perhaps from the IJA?
Ah, you must be I-7! Konnichiwa! Well, in truth we have, but... Moving to such an area with our troops is dangerous. We'd rather conserve as much as we can to protect my-- er, Keijō's station.
Sou datta. Then where shall we cross swords?
Well! Since you're brave enough to ask, we were thinking you could help me-- I mean, us out. Some Morganas are causing trouble upstream near Guri. Consider it a... test! Yes, a test of your skill.
Hai. Ah, forgive me. May I speak with my kanchou, please?
Hai, ii desu.
Kanchou... Is it just me or do you notice that...

Fields.MenuText: Oh, brother. This guy's an oaf!
He's kind of shady. But we still have a mission.
Did the IJA think putting a monkey in charge would be funny?

Fields.DialogueText: Why are you calling him your brother? He IS an oaf. Ma... this is truly going to be rough. Well, as you say, Kanchou: let's do our best.
That is true... Something is telling me that this ridiculous oaf couldn't tell a difference between a sword and a broom handle. Yet this is still a divine order.
*Snrk* K-Kanchou, hanasunai de kudasai yo...! I-I cannot hold in my laughter well. *Snrk!* H-He may hear us! We must needs keep our calm a-and fight our best!
Is everything alright? Daijoubu desu ka? If you have trouble, look for my lieutenant! He is currently fighting in the front lines there and giving orders. Trusty, for a local.
Hai. We are currently en route to the location.
Well! Best of luck! I hope you are successful. I sent some of our boys out a while ago to aid him, but they haven't come back and--
Iie. Iie. We... have it... We have it under control; right, Kanchou?
Right. Begin operation!
@BATTLE
And you must be Lieutenant Sungmin.
That I am, konnichiwa, I-7 and Kanchou. Welcome to Korea. Did Mooroka-minatocho brief you? He wasn't too brash, was he?
He was...
... a character, for sure. Pleased to meet you, Lieutenant.
You fight decently for a chōsenjin. You have earned my favor. Tell me, does Morooka's operation run well here?
Haha! Thank you, I-7. I'll take that as a compliment. To answer your question, things have been... rough here. Strange things have been happening, but me and my men are holding steadfast.
Hah! 'Twould appear that the chōsenjin has more of a spine than the nihonjin. Perhaps you're a descendant of that accursed admiral from long ago?
I wish I had half of the strength that Yi Sun-sin had. Unfortunately, I am no more than a soldier. I have come to fight, and I will make sure the people of my homeland are safe. I promise you this.
Safety? You should be without fear. Safety may come second. As long as the enemy shall meet their blade at the end of--
Ah, chotto sumimasen. Forgive me. I must depart - we're meeting more resistance upstream. It was nice meeting you, I-7, Captain. Please be careful. Ganbatte kudasai yo.
M-Matte! I was not finished- ... Kanchou. Why are we *still* here?

Fields.MenuText: I mean, you kind of just insulted him.
We have a mission from the Navy Minister?
I-7-chan...

Fields.DialogueText: Insulted? If anyone is insulted, it is I. That impudent chōsenjin just walked off without proper manners! This place is...
He may be the Emperor's representative, but I am beginning to lose my patience. This place is full of ill-mannered chōsenjin. A cesspit!
Kuh! Don't you dare use such formalities with me! I may be under your command, but I will command respect! Are you like those irksome chōsenjin, too!? Do you intend on disregarding your station!?
I-7, seriously, cut it out. We've come here for the people. Think of those who you protected back at that festival. What would they say?
They would much rather those other battleship sows protect them! Meanwhile, I am stuck in a miserable country with insufferable people. What did Hideyoshi even begin to see in this place!?
This backwater excuse for an empire... I cannot hear myself think over the noise of this damn ocean and these hideous people! What--
I-7, the Koreans our are allies like any other people. We need to help them out. Complaining isn't going to make it any easier.
I do not want to remain here any longer than I must. The ocean is getting noisier.
You're right, it's been getting a bit noisier these days. But, I-7, we're in this together. If you wish to vent your frustration, there's a nearby Morgana on radar.
Wha!? Why didn't you say so! Yorokonde!
@BATTLE
Ha! Dokkoisho! Dokkoisho!
Dokkoisho! Dokkoisho!
Souran! Souran! Put your backs into it! More! More!
Souran! Souran!
I-7, a word?
Eh? What is there to discuss?
I need to talk to you about I-6. I've recieved some reports.
Ooogh... Hold a moment, let us get out of their earshot. So, what is it that you wish to talk to me about? What did that jinroku do this time?

Fields.MenuText: Did you happen to know anything regarding I-6's current state?
I-7... May I please ask you to refrain from drilling submarines too hard?
You know what you did.

Fields.DialogueText: Her current state? Nani wo shisa shi teiru no? As far as I know, that blasted I-6 is off ruining more missions for us as we speak. These submarines need to be drilled more.
Nani? What's this about, Kanchou? Are you trying to tell me how I should command those under me? I appreciate advice, but this is not the-- Wait, have they been going to you behind my back!?
Haa!? Such disrespect! Why are you accusing me of such things when I am unaware of what is being accused? If you wish to try me, Kanchou... Urk. (I've never heard that tone before!)
I-7, I-6 was found crying earlier according to some other officers. When she was asked what was wrong, she told us you went farther in dressing her down than normally.
*She* was crying? She nearly caused us to be attacked by an enemy Morgana after taking a detachment of submarines with her! None are to move unless ordered!
I-7, that's ultimately my call to make. What I-6 did was wrong, but you should've let me talk to her. Beating soldiers down will only lead to problems.
But it was her fault, Kanchou! I-6 moved without orders! Doesn't she have a kanchou? Why aren't they being talked to about this!? First I get stuck out in nowhereland, and now I'm being told off!?
I-7, your frustration is out of control. I don't want you to get in trouble. You know that.
Rrrgh... Kanchou... I...
Ah, great. Morganas. Listen, we will discuss this later. For now, we have to deal with this.
I'll cleave through them. I'm so mad that I cannot see straight!
Be careful.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, come in, please!
Lt. Sungmin, are you in distress!? You sound urgent!
Hai! We're pinned down up the coast among Incheon's outlying islands. The sea's been restless and they're getting swamped!
Roger that. We're en route yesterday. I-7!
Hai! Kanchou! What's going on? Is there an attack!?
Lt. Sungmin is pinned by Morganas out west. We're going to his rescue.
That... Huh, so the chōsenjin does have his faults--
Not the time, we need to move!
Hai! Ikimashou!
*PRESENTLY*
Wha!? How are there this many Morganas swarming here!? And they've already lost this many ships!?
Doesn't matter, we need to get rid of them! Prepare for battle, I-7!
I'll take out this trash that the chōsenjin left behind!
@BATTLE
Shukketsuzo! You all stand in my presence, standing around like hapless ducks! Even a third-rate submarine could take care of you, and now more of you come to die at my feet!
What!? More Morganas are coming? Damn it! They must've fallen into some sort of ambush. I-7, we need to retreat!
I will not! This mess needs to be solved. We are warriors, Kanchou! Warriors are without fear! Charge! Ike!

Fields.MenuText: Are you out of your mind!? There's too many!
I-7 we've already saved Sungmin and the others!

Fields.DialogueText: The overwhelming odds are what a warrior may live for! This is for glory, for the Emperor! Tennoheika banzai!!
He can go run in cowardice for all I care! I am clearing them out of here! This is a true warrior's calling!
Iie, Kanchou! I will stand and fight! Nothing can stop our march! Ike!!
Wait, what is...? Did that Morgana just..?
Huh? Ah! Kanchou, abunai da yo!
Huh! Kuh! That... That shell damn near grazed my hair...
K-Kanchou I... What do I...? (What have I done? I could've lost Kanchou... What... What do I do!?) Rrrgh! Taikyakuzo! Taikyaku shite yo!
Kanchou...
I-7? Are we out of the firefight? What happened?
You fainted after a Morgana shell flew by your head... M- Moushiwake gozaimasen deshita, Kanchou. If you will it, I will stab myself.
Woah! Woah! Slow down. None of that. I-7, you made a mistake and got ahead of yourself. I'm alive. It's all right. But we need to talk more.
That battle was...

Fields.MenuText: Regrettable, but it happens.
I-7, I need you to listen to me from now on. All right?
Jealousy is hard to deal with.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou... I'm sorry. I promise I will do better next time. You have my word. I will train harder. I will listen to your orders and not fail to do so again.
Kanchou... I thought I could handle things myself. That we could conquer the islands back and the ocean with it. It was my mistake... I will try harder next time.
J-Jealous!? Who is jealous!? H-Hmph... I understand, Kanchou. From here on I promise that I will do better. I will have both me and my submarines in top order.
It's not about just listening, I-7. You also have to let things go. We're here. You may not like it, but we are. We're here to eliminate the Morganas and relieve Korea.
Kanchou... It stings. It stings like salt on a wound. But I shall listen to you.
I-7, you should also be listening to Sungmin. I don't care how you feel about Koreans. He's on our side. What's more, he's raised concerns over the state of things.
Concerns? The only thing that seems to be abnormal is the Morganas and the noise of the sea.
Nightmares among the civilians, food shipments being stolen... and there's a dreadful presence being felt up north. We need to be careful and approach this calmly.
I agree with your idea, but I do not think we should be too concerned with the chōsenjin. The food will come. Paranoia comes with the commotion. We must train harder.
I-7, these are legitimate concerns Sungmin is raising.
They are. However, if we can stop the Morganas now, half of those will be solved. The other half we may take care of later. I must begin my training for the day.
I-7, you're a Belle. Your first loyalty is to the people. *All* people.
... I will think on that, Captain, heresy though it may be. For now, may we clear out the port? These Morganas are an eyesore.
Let's take them out.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I have come-- Eh? It's the chōsenjin as well. What are you both talking about?
Sungmin has a report. It's not good.
Is it any worse than the sea's noise? It feels as if it has only been getting louder since we arrived.
Yes... I-7, it has gotten worse. We've got unexplained disappearances, and those who haven't disappeared are getting sick.
Has Morooka sent any food? That is his job.
He hasn't. We're running out of resources and people fast.
We lost a couple soldiers the other day who went just west of Seoul. They didn't come back. I'll see what we can do about food.
But what of the Morganas, Kanchou? Could they not attack at any moment? We are not made for food runs, our mission is to stop the disturbances.
I-7, these people need our help. We've come here because we have orders to help. More than that, I've told you, these people are our allies.
Yes, but our first priority is to stop the Morganas. Furthermore, our ships are not designed to carry food. The chōsenjin are the Army's responsibility, not ours.
Jya... Thank you for receiving my report, Kanchou. Shitsureishimasu, I must depart.
We'll make sure we do something about the food, Lieutenant. Don't worry. We are Belles first.
Understood. Well, good luck out there, Captain. ... I-7.
Kanchou, we simply don't have the resources. We have already lost many soldiers in vain trying to help the people.

Fields.MenuText: We are here to help, I-7.
It's hard, I'll give you that.
Why, I-7?

Fields.DialogueText: I am telling you, Kanchou! It is impossible for us to do more than we already are! Responsibility is firmly with that buffoon Morooka! Why should we have to suffer because he won't do his work!?
This situation is difficult. We do not have the resources to help the people. Even if we did, that's not our responsibility! We are to protect them and hunt down the Morganas!
Why!? I do not know why!? We've lost so many and the situation is rough at best. Morooka won't hand over any food! (... Could it be that I am in the wrong?)
I-7, we must have compassion. That's not easy in these times, but innocent lives are at stake. Sometimes you have to reevaluate what duty means.
But Kanchou, it is our directive... How would we even begin to help this situation!?
We will talk on this tomorrow, I-7. For now, we have one last Morgana to take care of. But, you understand what I'm saying, right?
... Hm. Wakarimashita.
Good, then let's do our best.
@BATTLE
And then there's the food shortages. We've had reports of starvation already.
Kanchou, I have something to report from General Morooka.
What could that oaf possibly have to say that isn't a waste of time?
Aside from Morooka's usual... nature, this is actually important. Kanchou, are you familiar with Chinnampo?
That's up north, right? What's happening there?
Simply put, Morooka has received reports from Captain Miyako's garrison there. The sea's noise is intense, and strange figures have been spotted walking about and rising from the ocean...
Hanashimasu ka? That's inane! Are you suggesting the enemy is somehow using the sea itself? How do we know those are not foreign spies!?
... Ah. Excuse me. ... Ahem! According to Morooka's report, they seem to coincide with disappearances.
But what does it mean? Are those figures hurting anyone?
They mostly just walk around. Whenever they're seen, they hide. But the sea is still getting noisier...
Oh, so now we have yuurei about? You expect me to believe such raff!? What sort of idiot do you take me for?

Fields.MenuText: I don't like this. This is getting worse.
Could it be possible that the Morganas are using them?
I-7, we must act.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course it is! Chōsen has been nothing but miserable, and now that buffoon has the audacity to throw these weird people at me!? What do they take me for!? Kuh... Yet...
Morganas cannot create things! ... At least, I do not think they can. Either way, using humans seems foolhardy! Therefore, it simply cannot be possible; the enemy are shrewder than that. Yet...
Act upon what, Kanchou? Baseless rumors provided to us by a second-rate ape who somehow got into a high position? I would rather trust an Echigoya! We are hunting for Morganas! Yet it is strange...
Either way, we'll be on the lookout for it. We've got some supplies coming into Seoul soon. However, if you need us, please tell us immediately and we'll come running.
This is annoying! Why should we even head out there when these are naught but rumors? First insubordination by my submarines, now faceless rumors... Kanchou...! Mou... iya!
I-7, I-7... Please. We'll talk later, but orders are orders. If what Morooka has said is true, we could have some real danger on our hands.
Aaaaugh... Kanchou... Hmph! Hai, I will come along in the future if needs be.
Thank you, Kanchou. ... If I can butt in, I believe I've just gotten a signal from up the coast. Morgana trouble.
Kanchou, ittekimashou ka?
Hai, ittekimasu.
@BATTLE
How can more people be dead!? What are you doing standing around!?
We have been doing our best. Seoul's in disarray, we've lost many men, Incheon is showing signs of struggle; what else should we do?
You should get back up and train harder! You cannot imply that you have given it your best if yet more of your men are gone and the citizens are--
HANASUNAIDE!
N-Nani--
Hanasunaide! You have done nothing but whine, moan, and act haughty the entire time I have been working with you! You disregard our reports and dismiss our sacrifices!
And when the Captain tries to make you think of the people, you refuse! What do you know of people, I-7? Do you know what I had to do yesterday!? I had to tell a widow that her husband drowned!
You do no--
The tears in her and her son's eyes when I told them hurt my soul. Do you know how many civilians we've lost? What have you done to help other than blow things up?
Nothing! You would rather train than fight because you feel we are not your responsibility!
Even your submarines can no longer bear your ignorance! To hell with that occupier Morooka, but at least he does his job!
K-Koi--
I have nothing but respect for your captain. No one else in this entire world would put up with a half-assed excuse for a Belle like you.

Fields.MenuText: I-7, are you alright? I just came--
I have never seen someone go off like that...

Fields.DialogueText: I... I don't know what to say.
I... I cannot blame him.
Kanchou...
I wish I knew what to say.
... I feel... Kanchou... It is not...
Ah! I-7, please! There's a Morgana headed right this way. We must defend ourselves! ... And after, we've got to talk.
Kanchou... Mou, arigatou...
@BATTLE
K-Kanchou.
I-7..? What's going on? Are you alright? I know that whole thing with Sungmin the other day is--
It is not that, Kanchou. The other submarines have begun to... disobey me. They will not train, listen to orders, or even look at me half of the time...
Hasn't one of them at least talked to you?
A few of them have. But... The ones that have talked to me agree, but they waver or quiver. I... I even have tried to lessen my rigidness, I wish to bridge the gaps...
That's a fantastic first step, I-7. You may not think so, but it is. They're just apprehensive right now because of what happened earlier. Please, keep at it.
Kanchou... I think that... The lieutenant was right... I... *sniff* I only think about my own problems... What kind of leader's men fear them...? (*sniffle*) I am nothing but a child!
I-7, you are not a child. You are a capable leader. I have seen you win fights no one else could.
Your faith is... *sniffle* m-misplaced. It's all misplaced..! All I've done on this trip was seethe in jealousy and hurt others! W-Why? Doushite... W-Watashi wa... hazure d-desu...

Fields.MenuText: [Hug I-7.]
I-7... I understand you.
[Remain silent and let her cry.]

Fields.DialogueText: K-Kanchou!!! Do n-not..! Uwwaaaaaaagh!!! K-Kanchouuu!!! G-Gommennnasaiiii!
K-Kanchou, it stings..! It huuuuuurts! I-I c-cannot bear this pain! Mudi! Muuuuuudii!
W-Whyyy!? Why!? The world has come to crash down around me and I am still such a self-serving...!
I-7, enough. You are much stronger than you think you are. This... situation is difficult. You've made big mistakes and now you feel you can't come back from them.
I cannot, Kanchou... You heard the lieutenant, Keijō's in t-tatters...! What do I do...? Nanika!?
I-7... What you are feeling right now is shame and regret. It's those who learn lessons from it that win in history.
Kanchou... It stings, it stings like a salvo.
And it will, I-7. It will sting for a long time. But you have to use that sting for better. Grief, pain, and struggle, they're normal. You shouldn't bottle them up, I-7.
Kanchou... But is that *sniff* not worthy of a leader?
A true leader isn't afraid to show emotion. To treat their subordinates like family. You can protest and say that makes fighting harder, but it is the truth.
Kanchou... Honto ni... Honto ni hanashita... A-Ah... Wakarimasu.
There, there... I promise we'll get through this. Each day will be a new chance. You just have to-- Eh? What is...
A-Ah!? Kanchou, what ARE those!? They look like people, but...! There are Morganas with them, too!
Whatever they are, we need to take care of them immediately! I-7, are you ready?
Ikuuuuuuzeee!!!
@BATTLE
I cannot believe it... The dead, walking...
I wonder what they are... Whatever they are, they're related to the Morganas, I'm sure of it.
Happyaku... Nanahyaku... We should be in Nampo, soon.
... Well, it looks like someone wants us to get there as soon as we can. Care for some practice?
My submarines have been innovative. I will allow them to indulge. Osu!
@BATTLE
Chinnampo at last. This rough sea has been difficult. I wonder if that has anything to do with the noise it's been making?
I am beginning to think that-- C-Chotto matte... Kanchou, look at all of this... I-Is this a port? There aren't even that many buildings!? Where are the people!? I-Is that smoke?

Fields.MenuText: This is horrible.
So... this is what Sungmin meant.
Has Morooka done... nothing?

Fields.DialogueText: Horrible cannot even begin to describe this place. This is... There is so little life here that the only sound is the wind! There are no birds, people, or anything! T-They cannot all be gone!
I-I thought it was not in such a state! What is all of this!? T-This... Even Satsuma after the Boshin War looked better than this! Is there anyone even here!?
Kuh...! I swear, I will write the Navy Minister about this incompetence! This is beyond incompetence! This is malice! Is anyone there!?
Hold that thought... We're getting a transmission from someone!
Excuse me, is that the vessel I-7 on my radar? Tokutei shitekudasai.
Watashi wa I-7 desu. To whom are we speaking?
Taii Minako desu. Yoroshiku onegaishimasu, I-7-san and Kanchou. Welcome to Nampo. Please forgive the situation we have here...
It isn't your fault. Can you please give us a status report? We want to assess what's happened here.
To put things... bluntly: We're running out of food, Morgana attacks are rampant, and something is wrong with the ocean itself. It's turning people into these... creatures.
The figures that rise out of the ocean?
Yes... They take people from the streets and drag them back into the ocean. They do the Morganas' dirty work, and people are so terrified of them that they won't leave their homes!
Kanchou... Kuosora! This is my fault! If I had only come earlier, I would have--
Save your breath, I-7. There's nothing we can do now except help.
Madamada, I-7-chan! The Kanchou has the right attitude. Ahem! Would you both care to join me for lunch?
Mochiron. We will be right over.
Food... Food... Tabemono... Will this be enough, Taii?
It will. Honto ni arigatou gozaimashita. This should suit the people of Chinnampo nicely.
Iie, kekko desu. If that buffoon Morooka cannot, we certainly can. None will starve under me!

Fields.MenuText: I'm glad to see you're smiling again, I-7.
Good boss.
Dokkoisho, dokkoisho!

Fields.DialogueText: Souran! Souran! Ehehehe! Thank you, Kanchou. Nothing may excuse my behavior earlier, but this is quite fun. Something about seeing others eat well reminds me of the submarines!
U-Uaaah!? Praising me as such... Kanchou, it was your idea! And, while I still don't forgive myself for earlier, I think that things are looking up now! Hopefully the submarines think so as well!
Thanks to you, Kanchou. You showed me the way. I believe I am still not the greatest... but! I have an opportunity to become better. I simply hope the submarines think so, too.
I'm sure they probably understand you better now. It might take some time before they can feel comfortable around you.
Mou... Kanchou, forgive me. I appreciate you telling me such, but I still feel quite hung up about it.
Kanchou is right. It will take some time, but before you restore harmony with others, you need to find it in yourself.
Nani? I was not expecting that to come out of you, Taii Minako.
Everything in this life has a spirit. You Belles teach me more about what that means every day. And, not to insult you, I-7. But you remind me a lot of a younger version of myself.
I-I do!? I do not recall being so spiritual! What else can you do with that, Taii?
I'm curious as well. Are you sure you're not a Belle captain in disguise?
The westerners call it "superstition," but I call it being spiritual. Commanding a Belle seems like hard work so, I'd rather wait until I'm older.
Let's hope the war doesn't last THAT long...
I agree. The sooner this ends, the sooner we can all go-- hmm.
Eeeh!? I just sensed them as well! Sugoi, Taii Minako, you are amazing! K-Kanchou, your orders!?
Move 'em out! Let's clean house!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I-7, there's a presence about... I think it may be Morganas.
Maaa... This is no fit exercise for our station.
Just a little more and we'll have completed this round of shipping. Once we have, we can begin training again.
I hope so. I understand you've encouraged me to let my submarines have breaks, but I do not want them to slack off!

Fields.MenuText: There's a difference between rest and idleness.
Don't you want to go surfing again, I-7?
I can assure you that they aren't.

Fields.DialogueText: Anyone who says there is is not working hard enough! What is the point in taking a break if you could be killed at any moment..? It is baffling. But... hmph!
C-Chotto matte! Kanchou! Hai, but... later. S-So please keep that quiet. Still, it's baffling we have such quiet time now.
They are not!? I will be the judge of that when I am done carrying these things... B-But, maybe they deserve a break, or two? H-Hmph. I do not like this downtime...
Kanchou is right, I-7. Downtime is good for your soul. I have not had much of it lately... so, it feels refreshing.
Taii Minako--
Oh, I-7, you can just call me Minako-chan if you want. You too, Kanchou. As I said, it's good for your soul!
M-Minako-chan... Do you like surfing at all?
I love surfing! Here in Korea, they host competitions sometimes, and they tell me the winner is crowned king for a day! But sometimes the waves are too rough for it...
They tell you-- You can understand Chōsengo!? You love surfing, as well!? Kanchou, am I dreaming? She is good at all of these things!
I don't think you're dreaming, I-7. You could be good at a lot of things, too. I know you can. I've seen you apply yourself before.
I agree with the Kanchou, I-7. You remind me a lot of my little sister in Okinawa. She's got a lot of talent as a radio personality, but she hasn't done anything with it yet. But I know she can!
Minako-chan... So earnestly believing in me... All right! Hm, I wonder what I should start with... Maybe being a better leader to the submarines... Kanchou, could you help me with that?
I'll give you plenty of pointers.
As will I, if I ever see you outside of Chinnampo, that is! But I hope I will. I'll be re-stationed by year's end to Okinawa if all goes well. I'm rooting for-- I-7?
Evil is skulking about. Do you sense it?
Hai. I do. Kanchou, if you'd mind? For whatever reason, Morganas have been getting bold lately...
Already on it. The sea's getting noisy again... (Could that have something to do with it?)
@BATTLE
Kanchou... that battle yesterday was...
Something wasn't right about it. I-7, do you have any reports about Chinnampo?
That is what I came to talk to you about, Kanchou. I used my scout plane to observe the surrounding area, and the situation is... irredeemable.
Irredeemable?
Morganas are littered throughout the port. I do not understand why any of them have not attacked us yet. Nearly all homes are barricaded and no one goes outside less they become... them.

Fields.MenuText: But we just brought food. Surely there's something we can do?
Then we'll just have to clear it out!
I-7, it's not hopeless.

Fields.DialogueText: Iie, Kanchou. This is dire. I saw a man get torn apart in the street. He flailed about before he... This is horrid. Barbaric even.
Kanchou... I regret to inform you that we're working with a third of our initial manpower. 40 percent of them are missing, 60 percent were killed. Mudi yo.
Kanchou... I wish I could say such things, but... just look around you. I observed nooses hanging from trees, starving dogs, torn-up playgrounds-- everything. Hope is gone, Kanchou.
That's... horrible! There must be more soldiers than you're letting on. We can contact the IJA for backup!
Mudi yo. We're it, Kanchou. Morganas keep coming. Morooka will not send any help until it is too late.
Are the Morgana creating some sort of supercell? This is catastrophic. I-7, we have to do something.
I will stand and fight. However, I am of the opinion that if worse comes to worst, drastic actions must be taken.
What drastic actions are you implying, I-7?
We fight until we can reasonably assume that the IJA will come. If they do not, I suggest we shell Chinnampo itself.
What are you even saying I-7!? There are still people alive here!
Kanchou, they will all die in the end if the Morganas should encroach any farther. What we are doing for the chōsenjin would be nothing short of mercy.
Are you LISTENING to yourself talk!? That will not happen, I-7! You're here to protect people, not destroy them!
Would you prefer to sit and watch Orochi devour the eight maidens!? These people are damned!
Listen to me, I-7. We're not out of options yet. What about Minako? What do you think this port means to her!?
Kanchou--
What about the people, I-7!? What if it was Minako and her sister!?
Kuh... K-Kanchou! Look out!
Let's go.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, we're boxed in. Please, consider what I'm saying!
We cannot abandon the people, I-7! I won't allow it!
Mou, HANASUNAIDE!
This situation is tense, but arguing about it will not solve anything! Now... I-7, we are not able to leave port, correct?
That is correct. There are too many Morganas, and even if we pick off their crew more rise from the sea.
I've been trying to draft battle plans, but we simply don't have enough firepower to break through or deal serious damage.
... So it has come to this. I wish it didn't have to, but such are the times we live in. Kanchou, I-7: I have a plan. I will gather as many as I can with what soldiers I have from the city.
You and your submarines get them out of here. I'll cover you as you make off with what you can. Ferry them across to Seoul where it's safe.
Minako, that's a brilliant--
--way to lose all conceivable honor! Why would you not fight it out! Are you not aware of Nobunaga!? We were born to die! I will stand and fight until I can fight no longer!
Chotto, Kanchou. I-7-chan. I understand that you are in a foreign land, among strangers, being forced to deal with Morooka, and far from Kure. It must be hard.
Jealousy, anguish, terror; you must all be feeling that now. But... you must be compassionate. You must save lives. Please, I-7. Help them.

Fields.MenuText: Minako is right, I-7.
The Emperor would say the same.
This is a true warrior.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, you cannot be agreeing with this! If we were to leave, we would be abandoning all hope! We must fight for that hope until we drop! We... cannot... just lay down!
How dare you invoke the Emperor, His Imperial Majesty! How dare you!? Kanchou, he would order us to fight until the death! To lay our swords upon Chinnampo until we drop! Please, Kanchou...
Kanchou... M-Minako-chan! You cannot do this to me! We must fight! We m-must!
I-7, it must be done. We need to save as many people as we can and leave. I understand what Minako is saying.
I-7-chan, the Kanchou is right. This will be hard, but if you do it, we can save--
B-B-Both of you, quit talking! Enough! Y-You... *sniff* can't force me to make... *sniff* *gasp* s-such a horrible choice! Where is your warrior's *hurk* pride!? I-I don't...!
I-7-chan... I...
(*Tears stream down I-7's face as a the hull shakes...*)
Kanchou, we--
Already on it. Don't worry, I-7. We'll get through this. You have my word.
@BATTLE
Kanchou.
I-7... how are you feel--
I want to begin this rescue operation immediately. I am ready. My submarines are ready.
Are you sure, I-7? Have you completely made your decision?
Ikkimashou, Kanchou. We have no time.
Wakarimashita, I-7. I will tell Minako immediately. She's gathered the people. We need to get rid of the Morganas blocking the path to the main shipyard.
Leave it to me... Submarines, hoi!
Hai!
Today begins the long march of reckoning! For if you cannot protect what you have today, you may as well not see tomorrow! Together, submarines, will you stand by me!?
Uooooooaaahhhh! Taichou! Taichou! Taichou! Taichou!

Fields.MenuText: In another life, you could be a politician.
I've never seen them so riled up!
I'm proud of you, I-7.

Fields.DialogueText: Perish the thought, Kanchou. I am who I am. My principles, my sword, my honor... Yet, I know what duty I must adhere to.
They will be riled up more when we begin our march. This is a duty, Kanchou. I have made my choice. To save others... I will do my best.
Kanchou... It makes me incredibly happy to hear you say that. Honto ni arigatou...
I will make battle preparations, I-7. Go and head out to rally them.
Wakarimashita, Kanchou.
What a situation we're in... Hm? What is this? It looks like a sash and a medal... Wait, d-don't tell me this is Minako's!? Why did she leave these..?
Kanchou! The Morganas have begun to engage us!
Push them back!
Banzaiiiii!!!
UUUUUOOOAHHHHH!
@BATTLE
Collecting the locals was a bit easier than I had expected... Why are they lighter than the cargo!?

Fields.MenuText: Well, people don't tend to be made of steel.
You've grown stronger!
The might of a warrior softens the blow.

Fields.DialogueText: That they are not... yet, that food earlier was made not of steel? Er, but it was kept in steel. That is probably why... Hm! Full speed ahead!
If I have, I do not feel it clearly yet! Therefore, battle shall decide if I am. And by Koukinjitsu, I will cleave my foes in twain! Onward, to battle and to save these people!
My sword is justice. My mind is balanced. My soul... is no longer burdened!
Then let's be about it! ... This is going to get rough!
ZENSHINNNN!
@BATTLE
An opening! Minako's cover is doing its work!
I will cleave through every last Morgana that blocks my path!
... Hm? We're receiving a transmission. ... It's Minako!
What!? Is she not on any of the submarines!?
I knew it.
Kanchou, I-7, omingoutou. I have been observing your progress from the harbor. You should have no trouble reaching Seoul. I... I have a confession to make.
Minako-chan! Why aren't you with us!? What's--!?
In truth... my name is not actually Minako; or, it was not the name I was born with. I am a daburu. My name is Mingrye. I... I didn't want I-7-chan to feel uncomfortable.
Minako-chan! The port is on fire! Get out of--
I imagine I-7 must be begging me to leave, Kanchou. But I can't. Both my sister and I were born here. I cannot bring myself to abandon it.
Minako..! You will die! Please! Onegai! Get out of there! Leave! Dekakezo! Minaaaako! D-Don't...!
Kanchou. It was a pleasure meeting you. You are a fine kanchou and I have no doubt that with you at the helm, the war will be won. But... I implore you. Please, never give up on I-7.
I-7 should keep practicing her compassion and know that her heart is big. I know she's going to struggle, but please, help her get back up when she falls. She has so much potential.
Minako-chan! Don't... *hic* don't do this!
I... don't know how things will go, but please make sure she knows that she's amazing, Kanchou. Thank you for all your help. A- *bzzt* rigatou goza *fssh!* shita. Annyeonghee gasip *bzzzt*
... Damn. The transmission is lo--
Minako!! ... You... *hic!* Onore!!! *gasp* N-No... Yada, yada, yada..!
(*The Captain hugs I-7.*)
Mingrye...!
This damn sea... It does not want us to leave!
Well, tough! We're getting out! Mingrye didn't give us time for nothing!

Fields.MenuText: Come on, I-7! She believes in you, I believe in you!
We have to keep going!
Fall down seven times, stand up eight.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou... These steps are hard, and filled with pain! B-But I will persevere! You both believe in me!
I-If I am with you, Kanchou... My blade, my heart, my soul! Through my sorrow... both Mingrye and you are cheering me on!
If you and Mingrye have put their faith and me; who am I... to give up!?
The enemy's forming a line ahead. You know what to do with that.
I am the mighty I-7, peerless of blade! I shall slice you from your formation like so much chaff!
@BATTLE
It looks like we got past them. Wonderful job, I-7.
Ma... Arigatou gozaimasu. Sentaku shimashita. ... Eh? Kanchou? Are those battleships!?
About time we had some backup! Let me send a transmission through... is there anyone there!?
I-7 identified. Kanchou, is that you? You're alive! Yokkatta... Don't worry about Chinnampo, we'll take it from here.
Good! Listen, there are a ton of people boarded up in the shipping district. You have to rescue them!
... Gomen nasai, Kanchou. Those are not our orders. We were given the command of shodo sakusen. We'll clear out the Morganas and whatever else is here.
Shodo sakusen...? Ah! That's scorched earth!
Nani!? You cannot do that! Our soldiers are there! Captain Minako...! Do not proceed! Ikanaide kudasai!
Forgive us, Kanchou. It... It's reprehensible. But we have our orders. If there are survivors, we will see what we can do. Sumimasen.
Kusora! Who GAVE you that order!? Kotaeru!
I-7-sama, I cannot answer--
As her captain, I demand you answer.
... Morooka, Kanchou. It was under his order that the situation in Chinnampo be dealt with. Too much was sunk. Moushiwaki gozaimasen, Kanchou. I have to end transmission. May your travels be safe.
No...! We're already too far away, too... We have to keep moving...
Kuh...! Inu ga, mina inu ga! Onore...!
Look at all of these Morganas... We have already lost three submarines!
We have to keep moving! The sea is fighting with us!
Kanchou... I realize it now.
Realize what?
The Morgana are using this ocean as... what is the word!? It is like a circle of spiritual energy to feed other spirits!

Fields.MenuText: That's a "conduit!" No way!
So... that's why the sea's been choppy nonstop.
Good thinking, I-7.

Fields.DialogueText: A kon-su-iito!? What a strange word! But, yes, that is what they are using! They have turned the ocean against us! Why did I not see it sooner!?
I wish I had seen it earlier! All I knew is that the sea was in an uproar! If only we had known earlier, we could have evacuated everyone! H-Hidoi yo...
A-Arigatou, Kanchou! But this is not the time for praise! Kuso... If only I had seen it earlier, this entire tragedy could have been prevented!
We can't change the past, no matter how much it hurts. All we can do now is push through. There's a couple of Morganas ahead. Are you ready?
Always! Taste my steel!
@BATTLE
Another brilliant battle. Well done, I-7-- huh? Another transmission?
What is that noise, Kanchou? It sounds like a bunch of beeps and boops?
It's morse code, I-7. It says... "M-I-N-G-R-Y-E-T-O-I-7." It's Mingrye!
What!? What is she saying!?
"O-P-E-N-Y-O-U-R-H-E-A-R-T..." Open your heart. "W-A-W-A-M-A-E-M-I-T-T-E-I-R-U..." Watashia wa mae mitteiru... Wait... Wait!
Kanchou! Mingrye! Is she saying anything more!? Please tell me, Kanchou! Why have you gone pale!? Kanchou! Kanchou...
The transmission got cut off, I-7.
I-7... I'm sorry.
Open your heart... *sniff* I suppose I... *sniff* I really should... I should have...

Fields.MenuText: [Console I-7.]

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou... *sob*
Move out of my way! Kutabare omae!
One last group! Don't stop now!
@BATTLE
Tattsunaizo!

Fields.MenuText: I have never seen a Morgana be decapitated...
That's the way! A bit gruesome, but that's the way!
And... it's over.

Fields.DialogueText: They deserve more for their cruelty! No mercy shall be given! I will protect these people!
No mercy for them! None! I shall not rest until we are past them and all of the people aboard me are safe!
Iie, Kanchou!The nightmare has scarcely begun! But I will not wake until I have vanquished all who stand in my way! These people will be safe. I will do it for Mingrye!
I would do the same, albeit with less fervor. ... Hm? Incoming transmission from General Morooka.
... He is the last person I wish to talk to.
It says: "I-7, Kanchou, honto ni arigatou gozaimashita. You've done wonderfully, and now the IJA will take care of the situation. Please don't fret about Chinnampo. You've got gifts waiting!"
... You do not have to include this in your reply, Kanchou. But: Morooka is a damned coward. He is beneath even our contempt.
I agree... Hm? There's another transmission.
If it is from that oaf, I would sooner dull my blade on a hay bale.
No, it's from Lt. Sungmin!
What does it say?
"Kanchou and I-7. I cannot thank you enough for your work. The decision to scorch earth was not my own, but Morooka made it anyway. Nothing can excuse my failure to stop it."
"To I-7. I misjudged you, and for that I am sorry. You have saved so many and grown so much. Mingrye's trust in you is proof of that."
Sungmin-san...
"My regards to you. Mingrye believed in you, and now I do as well. Omingotou, I-7. Thank you for everything. Please take care of yourself."
... Kanchou. We're so close to Keijō. But should we not head to Incheon?
You've been doing research? Why Incheon?
I believe Morooka will try to silence these refugees. If we can get to Incheon, we may have a chance--
I'm already on it.
Kanchou! Honto ni... Arigatou!
Damn! They even block the way to Incheon!?

Fields.MenuText: These Morganas REALLY don't want to let these people go.
Do you think this is their last ditch effort?
Annoying...

Fields.DialogueText: We will not stop now! If I have to dismember them to keep their hands off of the innocent, I will!
Not even those pitiful amerikajin are this desperate! For Mingrye, Sungmin, and all of these civillians... This ends NOW!
Sansei da yo na... Grrgh! I will wash my hair in their ignorant blood! This is where it ends!
I-7! Advance and attack!
Yosh, todoke!
@BATTLE
YOOOSH! ORE NO SHOKI DA!
The noise is intense!
I would yell, too, if I was not so tired...
To be quite frank, I'm really tired. But, at least these Koreans can reintegrate with the locals here.
Sou desu ka? Ureshii desu yo. We have fought so hard for this...
Kanchou! Some of the chōsenjin wish to ask you: they would like to be relocated to Okinawa!
What!? We cannot just put them into Nihon!? That is not only illegal, but it is against the will of the Emperor!
They say that I-7, you inspired them! They wish to start over elsewhere!
Mou... Why must I always be saddled with such impertinent decisions!?
Welcome to my world... I-7, since these people have been displaced and their homes are gone, they technically count as refugees. Your constitution allows them to relocate.
... Mingrye...
It is your--
Tell those who wish to come to bring along supplies. Okinawa ni ikkimasu.
I'm proud of you, I-7. Mingrye would be, too.
... I hope that she is smiling.
Kanchou! Okiru! There is a Morgana ahead!
This early... didn't they learn their lesson?
No, they have not. It would appear the ships who were stationed at Okinawa have not, either.
Let's go.
@BATTLE
It's surprised me how welcoming the people of Okinawa are...
Well... The people of Ryukyu are sometimes considered by the people of Nihon to be gaikokujin, so it would make sense. B-But that is beside the point. I am glad. They can start over here.

Fields.MenuText: Let's see those other ships try to top what you did.
I'm proud of you, I-7.
Mingrye...

Fields.DialogueText: Hah! They must be incredibly embarassed for that situation to happen at Chinnampo! I... hope that these chōsenjin have fulfilling lives here. Mingrye would have wanted it.
Kanchou... I cannot help beaming with pride in you, either. You have helped me in such tremendous ways through this journey... I still miss Mingrye, but I feel her smile.
I hope that wherever she is, she can have all the fun she missed out on. I hope her cheerfulness lives on through these people.
Her memory is here. I met with her sister this morning.
You did!? What did she say..?
She thanked you, I-7. She thanked you and... well, she wept for her sister. Mingrye and Hwarye... I gave her Mingrye's sash and badge. With any luck, she'll also be recieving Mingrye's pension.
So it is true... she's...
They found her body yesterday. I'm sorry for not telling you, but you were embroiled in battle and I--
Kanchou, daijyoubu yo. ... I think that this journey is a sorrowful road. I... will never forget the sacrifices of my submarines, the soldiers, and... Mingrye.
I think that in the end, such hardships are what build a warrior. To blindly face fear, to experience such harsh loss, and to once again stand beyond... Korera desu.
It's not about the glory. It's about being with your comrades and fighting for what you believe in.
Sou desu. ... Kanchou... Does Mingrye have a grave?
Hwarye said she'll make one.
... May we please visit it? I wish to lay a higanbana.
Of course we will, I-7. Of course we will.
